Top Sights] His. Monuments Famous Hotels Upcoming Events
The Red Fort Lotus Temple Purana Qila Gurudwara Bangla Sahib Rashtrapati Bhavan Laxminarayan Temple Parliament House
Red Fort has become a grand and attractive place for the tourists from the India as well as abroad. Architect: Fariborz Sahba
Expressionist architecture. There are three gates in Purana Qila named Talaqi Darwaza, Bara Darwaza and Humayun Darwaza. Connaught Place, Next to Grand Post Office
Arch style: Sikh architecture. The most prominent aspect of Rashtrapati Bhavan is its dome which is superimposed on its structure. Creator: Baldeo Das Birla
Hindu temple architecture. It is one of the most magnificent buildings in New Delhi which has one of the brightest clusters.

Qutb Minar India Gate Tomb of Safdar Jang Humayun's Tomb Tughlaqabad Fort Tomb of Sikandar Lodi Raj Ghat
It was started building in 1193 by the Qutb-ud-din Aibak however carried on by his successor named Iltutmish. Robert Garside, a British runner began the first run around-the-world run from India Gate in October 2000. Arch style : Mughal architecture
Burials: Safdar Jang. It is said that the it was built at the cost of 15 lakh rupees (1.5 million). The fort's massive ramparts and bastions speak volumes about the might of the Sultanate. Islamic architecture
Hindu temple architecture. Jawaharlal Nehru's samadhi is to the north of the Raj Ghat and is known as the Shantivan or Shanti Vana.
